title: Big Bend National Park: Current Conditions
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Current Conditions             Alerts & Conditions         Alerts    Caution        High Temperature Warning  Alert 1 , Severity ,caution ,, High Temperature Warning  Dangerous heat indexes are normal for this time of year. Daily temperatures at lower and mid elevations can be well over 100 degrees, with heat indexes over 115. Avoid activity during mid-day. Protect yourself from the sun. Check tires. Have extra water.     Information        Severe Water Shortage  Alert 1 , Severity ,information ,, Severe Water Shortage  A severe water shortage exists throughout the park. Visitors are limited to 5 gallons per day, and are encouraged to conserve further when possible. Please consider bringing your own water to the park.          Extreme Water Shortage in the Chisos Basin  Alert 2 , Severity ,information ,, Extreme Water Shortage in the Chisos Basin  The Chisos Basin is currently experiencing an extreme water shortage.  The RV dump station in the Chisos campground is closed.  A smoking ban on the Chisos trails continues to prevent wildfire risk.  Bring your own drinking water to the park
